page.title: 16 A KETTERING CELEBRITY
page.content: During the war Mr. J.L. Carr was an R.A.F. photographer and then an intelligence officer in Africa. He moved to Kettering from Yorkshire 34 years ago and became head of Highfields School. He loved sport and played cricket for Kettering. Because he loved drawing he has drawn 400 pictures of Northants. In the Parish Church are three carvings he has sculptured out of Weldon stone. As a teacher he loved children's sense of humour, history and sport. After many years as a teacher he left because he liked taking risks and wanted a change. He bacame an author and wrote several successful novels. 'A Month in the Country' won the Guardian Fiction prize in 1980. Soon his latest book, Â£The Battle of Pollocks Crossing' will be for sale.
